newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan vegoil rates seen higher next week.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan vegoil rates seen higher next week.

text.p: Pakistani vegetable oil rates are likely to increase in the next trading week after a rise in world prices and low imports, dealers said on Saturday.

"Local vegoil rates would rise as the Malaysian vegoil market is bullish," said dealer Akbar Puri of Jalil Brothers Ltd. "In the weeks ahead, vegoil imports would also remain low as no major shipment is coming."
Domestic vegoil prices eased last week on a technical correction after recent sharp gains, but will rise this week, dealers said.
There will be no increase in Pakistan's vegoil imports in fiscal 1997/98 (July-June) because of good local production, Puri said.
"The arrival of cottonseed is good from the Sindh province, while from Punjab (province), it will pick up by the end of this month," he said.

Five ships with about 64,000 tonnes of vegoil are due in the next couple of days while 130,000 tonnes of unsold stocks -- almost unchanged from the previous week, are available in the market, Sault Enterprises said.
